definitions.text:
a snare, trap (especially for catching birds) hence, met: stratagem,
                  device, wile.

(a) suffering, affliction, (b) passion, emotion, (c) an undergoing, an
                  enduring.

a boy's guardian or tutor, a slave who had charge of the life and
                  morals of the boys of a family, not strictly a teacher.

discipline; training and education of children, hence: instruction;
                  chastisement, correction.
an instructor, trainer; almost: a chastiser.
(a) I discipline, educate, train, (b) more severely: I chastise.
a little child, an infant, little one.
a female slave, maidservant, maid, young girl.

I play, sport (includes singing and dancing), play in the manner of
                  children.

(a) a male child, boy, (b) a male slave, servant; thus: a servant of
                  God, especially as a title of the Messiah, (c) a female child, girl.
of old, long ago, in times past, former.
old, ancient, not new or recent.
I make old, declare obsolete; pass: I grow old, become obsolete.

wrestling, a wrestling bout; hence: a struggle, fight, conflict,
                  contest.
again, further, on the other hand
again, back, once more, further, on the other hand.
Pamphylia, a Roman province on the south coast of Asia Minor.
with one's whole household or family
with one's whole household or family.
from all sides, from all parts.
complete, entire, perfect, through all time.
from all sides, on all sides.
ruler of all, ruler of the universe, the almighty.
wholly, entirely, in every way, by all means, certainly.
gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
I urge, press, constrain by entreaties.

(a) a comparison, (b) a parable, often of those uttered by our Lord,
                  (c) a proverb, an adage.
I expose myself to danger, am reckless
I expose myself to danger; I am adventuresome, reckless.
a command, charge, injunction; a precept, rule of living.
I notify, command, charge, entreat solemnly.

(a) I come on the scene, appear, come, (b) with words expressing
                  destination: I present myself at, arrive at, reach.
I pass by, depart, pass away
I pass by, depart, pass away.
I put to open shame, make a public example of, put to disgrace.

I hand over, pledge, hand down, deliver, commit, commend, betray,
                  abandon.
I make jealous, provoke to jealously, provoke to anger.
a deposit, anything committed to one's charge or trust.

I beg off, make excuse, deprecate, refuse, reject, decline, shun,
                  avoid.
I sit down beside, set beside.

(a) I send for, summon, invite, (b) I beseech, entreat, beg, (c) I
                  exhort, admonish, (d) I comfort, encourage, console.
I am present with, rest with
I am at hand, am present with, rest with.

a calling for, summons, hence: (a) exhortation, (b) entreaty, (c)
                  encouragement, joy, gladness, (d) consolation, comfort.

(a) an advocate, intercessor, (b) a consoler, comforter, helper, (c)
                  Paraclete.

I accompany, follow closely, characterize, both lit. and met.; I
                  investigate.
I refuse to hear, disobey, disregard

(a) I hear carelessly or incidentally, or I pretend not to hear, (b) I
                  refuse to hear; I disobey, disregard.
I stoop, peer in, look down
I stoop, peer in, look down, look intently.

I take from, receive from, or: I take to, receive (apparently not used
                  of money), admit, acknowledge; I take with me.
adjacent to the sea, on the coast.
I deceive, beguile, reason falsely, mislead.
I remain by, abide with; met: I persevere in.
comfort, consolation, an exhortation, persuasion, encouragement.

I fall away, fall back (into the unbelieving and godless ways of the
                  old time).
I go past, pass by, pass along by.
a falling away, lapse, slip, false step, trespass, sin.
I am lost, perish, drift away

(lit: I flow past, glide past, hence) I am lost, perish, or merely: I
                  drift away (fall away) from duty.
I prepare; mid: I prepare, make preparations.
the day of preparation, the day before the Sabbath, Friday.
I set before, serve, entrust to

(a) I set (especially a meal) before, serve, (b) act. and mid: I
                  deposit with, entrust to, (c) I bring forward, quote as evidence.
I come by chance, chance to meet.
adv. with force of adj: present, immediate, for the moment.
I turn aside, carry away, remove

I turn aside, carry away, remove, cause to pass away; pass: I am
                  misled, seduced.
I am out of my senses
I am out of my senses, am beside myself.
I am present, am near; I have come, arrived.
I bring in secretly, am at hand.
I enter secretly, come in by stealth.
I enter secretly, come in from the side.
I contribute besides, bring in besides, smuggle in.

(a) adv. used as adj: besides, outside, without, left over, in
                  addition, (b) prep: apart from, except.
a camp, barracks, army in battle array
a camp, fort, castle, barracks, army in battle array.
I trouble, cause disturbance to, annoy, harass.
residing in a strange country, a stranger
residing in a strange country; subst: a stranger, sojourner.

I pass by, pass away, pass out of sight; I am rendered void, become
                  vain, neglect, disregard.
overlooking, suspension, remission of punishment for.

act. and mid: I offer, provide, confer, afford, give, bring, show,
                  cause.
a maiden, virgin; extended to men who have not known women.

a Parthian, an inhabitant of the country beyond the eastern boundary of
                  the Roman Empire between the Caspian Sea and the Persian Gulf.

(a) I let pass, neglect, omit, disregard, (b) I slacken, loosen; pass:
                  I am wearied.
I bring, present, come up to and stand by
I bring, present, prove, come up to and stand by, am present.
Parmenas, one of the original seven deacons at Jerusalem.
I sojourn, dwell in as a stranger.
a sojourning, a dwelling in a strange land.
foreign, alien, subst: a foreigner, sojourner.
a cryptic saying, an allegory; a proverb, figurative discourse.
I stir up, incite, urge on.

(a) presence, (b) a coming, an arrival, advent, especially of the
                  second coming of Christ.
prop: a dainty side-dish; meton: a plate, dish, platter.
freedom, openness, especially in speech; boldness, confidence.
I speak freely, boldly; I am confident.
all, the whole, every kind of
all, the whole, every kind of.
the feast of Passover, the Passover lamb
the feast of Passover, the Passover lamb.

I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill
                  treatment, suffer.
Patara, a town on the coast of the Roman province Lycia.
I smite, strike (as with a sword), smite to death, afflict.

Patmos, a small rocky island in the Aegean sea, south-west of
                  Ephesus.
a patricide, a murderer of his father.
a patriarch, head or founder of a family.
ancestral, paternal, belonging to the fathers (ancestors).
handed down by (from) one's ancestors, inherited.

(a) act: I cause to cease, restrain, hinder, (b) mid: I cease, stop,
                  leave off.
Paphos, a city at the western end of Cyprus.
I fatten, thicken; pass. fig: I become stupid, dull, unfeeling.
a shackle, fetter for the feet.
I travel on foot, by land.
I obey one in authority, conform to advice, obey, follow.
I am hungry, needy, desire earnestly.

(a) trial, probation, testing, being tried, (b) temptation, (c)
                  calamity, affliction.
persuasion, conviction, a yielding to persuasion.
I send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.
one who works for his living; a laborer, poor man.
Pentecost, a feast of the Jews, the fiftieth day after Passover.
over, on the other side, beyond.
(a) a boundary, limit, extremity, (b) an end, conclusion.
Pergamum, an important city of the Roman province Asia.

Perga, a city on the river Cestrus in the Roman province
                  Pamphylia.
I lead or carry about (or around), go about, traverse.

(a) I strip off, strip from, take away, (b) I cast off, cut adrift,
                  cast loose.

I cast around, wrap a garment about, put on; hence mid: I put on to
                  myself, clothe myself, dress; I draw (a line).
a wrapper, mantle, veil, cloak, covering.
I overdo, am a busybody, waste my labor about (a thing).

of persons: over-careful; curious, meddling, a busy-body; of things:
                  over-wrought; superfluous; curious, uncanny; subst: curious arts, magic.
I move about, make a circuit, tack

I go around, move about, visit; I make a circuit, tack (as a
                  ship).

(a) I contain (of a book containing subject matter); hence: it stands
                  (has its content) thus, (b) I encompass, surround, get hold of, seize.

I gird round; mid: I gird myself, generally for active work or
                  travel.
a putting around or on (as of ornaments).
in intrans. act. tenses: I stand around; mid: I avoid, shun.
I cover up, cover round about, veil round, blindfold.

I lie about, surround; I am encompassed, surrounded, or clothed with,
                  am in submission to.
having full power over, mastering, gaining control over.
I conceal, hide (by putting something around it).
I leave behind; pass: I am left behind, remain, survive.
I dwell around, am neighboring to.
a section or passage of Scripture.

I walk, hence Hebraistically (in an ethical sense): I conduct my life,
                  live.
I put on a spit; met: I pierce, wound deeply.
I fall into the midst of
I fall into the midst of, am involved in, happen upon a place.
I acquire, earn, purchase, make my own, preserve alive.
I tear off, as of garments.

(a) intrans: I exceed the ordinary (the necessary), abound, overflow;
                  am left over, (b) trans: I cause to abound.

more, greater, excessive, abundant, exceedingly, vehemently; noun:
                  preeminence, advantage.
greater, more, even more, more abundantly.
I place or put around, clothe; fig: I bestow, confer.
I carry around, am driven to and fro
I carry around; pass: I am driven to and fro.

neighboring; subst: the neighboring country, neighboring
                  inhabitants.
Persis, name of a Christian lady in Rome.
a rock, ledge, cliff, cave, stony ground.
rue, a plant used for flavoring food
rue, a plant used for flavoring or garnishing food.
a fountain, spring, well, issue, flow.
a sack, wallet for carrying provisions.
a cubit, about a foot and a half.
I lay hold of, apprehend, catch, arrest.
I press down, press together, as in a measure.
I make bitter, embitter; pass: I grow angry or harsh.

bitterness, harshness, hence met: an embittered (resentful)
                  spirit.
fatness, as of the olive; richness.
I sell; pass: I am a slave to, am devoted to.
I fall, fall under (as under condemnation), fall prostrate.

Pisidia, a country of Asia Minor, being the south-western part of the
                  Roman province Galatia.
I believe, have faith in, trust in; pass: I am entrusted with.
faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
I convince, establish, give assurance to; pass: I am assured of.
I lead astray, deceive, cause to wander.
a wandering; fig: deceit, delusion, error, sin.

adj: misleading, deceiving, wandering; as subst: a deceiver,
                  imposter.
I form, mould, as a potter his clay.
formed, molded; fig: feigned, made up, counterfeit.
a street, public square, broad way.
I enlarge, make broad; met: of the growth of tenderness and love.
the greatest, the most, very great.
I weave together, plait, twist, braid.
I have more than enough; I abound, increase.
I take advantage of, overreach, defraud.
a covetous or avaricious person; one desirous of having more.
covetousness, avarice, aggression, desire for advantage.
I sail, travel by sea, voyage.
a blow, stripe, wound; an affliction, plague.
a multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage.
however, nevertheless, but, except that, yet.
full, abounding in, complete, completely occupied with.
I carry out fully, fully convince

(lit: I carry full), (a) I complete, carry out fully, (b) I fully
                  convince, satisfy fully, (c) I fully believe.

(a) a fill, fullness; full complement; supply, patch, supplement, (b)
                  fullness, filling, fulfillment, completion.
rich, abounding in, wealthy; subst: a rich man.
I become rich, am rich, abound in.
I make rich, cause to abound in, enrich.
riches, wealth, abundance, materially or spiritually.
spiritually, in a spiritual way; from a spiritual point of view.
I blow, breathe, as the wind.
I choke, throttle, strangle; hence: I drown.
strangled (i.e. killed without letting out the blood).
reaching to the feet (of a garment).
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause.
a thing made, a work, workmanship.
(a) a "maker," poet, (b) a doer, carrier out, performer.
various, of different colors, diverse, various.
I shepherd, tend, herd; hence: I rule, govern.

a shepherd; hence met: of the feeder, protector, and ruler of a flock
                  of men.
I make war, contend, fight, battle.
a city, the inhabitants of a city.
a ruler of a city, city magistrate.

(a) commonwealth, polity; citizen body, (b) (the Roman) citizenship,
                  citizen-rights, franchise.
I live the life of a citizen
I live the life of a citizen, live.
in many parts (one at one time, another at another, and so on).
very costly, very precious, of great value.
of great value, very costly, very precious.
(a) labor, toil, (b) pain, anguish, distress, suffering.

Pontus, a Roman province in the north of Asia Minor, bordering on the
                  Black Sea, governed along with Bithynia.
I lay waste, destroy, ravage, harass.
Porcius, the middle (gentile) name of the procurator Festus.
I fornicate; met: I practice idolatry.
a prostitute; met: an idolatrous community.
a fornicator, man who prostitutes himself.
far, far off, at a distance.
from afar, far off, from a distance.
a purple garment, indicating power or wealth.
a female seller of purple cloth
a female seller of purple cloth.
how much, how great, how many
how much, how great, how many.
of what kind, of what manner.
at one time or other, at some time, formerly.

a drinking cup, the contents of the cup; fig: the portion which God
                  allots.
I cause to drink, give to drink
I cause to drink, give to drink; irrigate, water.

Puteoli, the great harbor for traffic with Alexandria on the Bay of
                  Naples.
where, somewhere, anywhere; with numerals: somewhere about.
Pudens, a Christian man in Rome.
a thing done, a deed, action; a matter, an affair.
a business, an occupation, affair, transaction.
the official residence of the procurator

the palace at Jerusalem occupied by the Roman governor, or the quarters
                  of the praetorian guard in Rome.
an officer employed to execute judicial sentences
an officer employed to execute judicial sentences.

(a) a doing, action, mode of action; plur: deeds, acts, (b) function,
                  business.
a company formed into divisions (like garden-beds).

I do, perform, accomplish; be in any condition, i.e. I fare; I exact,
                  require.
it becomes, is fitting to, is right.
I am aged, act as an ambassador
I am aged, act as an ambassador.

an assembly of elders, the Sanhedrin, officers of the church assembly,
                  presbytery.

elder, usually used as subst.; an elder, a member of the Sanhedrin, an
                  elder of a Christian assembly.

Prisca, Priscilla, the former being the more correct and formal name,
                  the latter a diminutive and more familiar; a Roman lady, probably of good birth,
                  wife of the Jewish Christian Aquila.

Prisca, Priscilla, the former being the more correct and formal name,
                  the latter a diminutive and more familiar; a Roman lady, probably of good birth,
                  wife of the Jewish Christian Aquila.

(a) of place: before, in front of, (b) of time: before, earlier
                  than.

(a) trans: I lead forth; in the judicial sense, into court, (b)
                  intrans. and trans: I precede, go before, (c) intrans: I go too far.
I propose; mid: I propose to myself, purpose.
a porch, court before a building, vestibule.
I thrust forward, put forth (as of branches), produce.
I lead forward, lead on; met: I induce, incite, urge.

(a) I write previously (aforetime); I write above (already), (b) I
                  depict or portray openly, (c) I designate beforehand.
manifest to all, evident, very clear.
I give before, give forth, betray.
I hope before, am the first to hope.
I say previously, predict, proclaim, foretell.
I go forward, go on, advance; I go before, precede.
I prepare or appoint beforehand, predestine.
I preach the gospel beforehand, foretell good tidings.

trans: I hold before; mid: I excuse myself; intrans: I project, excel,
                  surpass, have preeminence.
I lead onward by example, go before, prefer.
a setting forth, the show-bread; predetermination, purpose.
readily, eagerly, with a ready mind, cheerfully.

I preside, rule over, give attention to, direct, maintain, practice
                  diligently.
I provoke, stimulate, challenge, call out.
I am set (placed, put) before, am already there.
I announce or preach beforehand, announce by herald.

(originally of the pioneer cutting his way through brushwood), I
                  advance, progress, make progress.
I take before, anticipate, am overtaken

I take before, anticipate; pass: I am caught or overtaken, taken by
                  surprise.
I tell (say) beforehand, forewarn, declare, tell plainly.
I predict, testify or protest beforehand.
I meditate beforehand, prepare, get up, premeditate.
I am anxious beforehand, ponder beforehand.
I take thought for beforehand, provide for, practice.

I see beforehand, foresee, see previously, am mindful of; mid: I pay
                  regard to, set before me.
I foreordain, predetermine, mark out beforehand.
I send forward, accompany, equip for a journey.
I precede, pass on before, go before.
I address by name, designate, accost.
I bring to, bring near; I come to or towards, approach.
I beg, ask earnestly, ask for in addition.
I go up to, come up to
I go up to, come up to, go up further.
I fill up by adding to, supply.
I want more, need in addition.

(a) I await, expect, (b) I receive, welcome (originally: to my house),
                  (c) I accept.
I expect, wait for, await, think, anticipate.
I permit one to approach, permit further.
I wait upon, minister to, have charge of.
I come up to, come to, come near (to), approach, consent (to).

(a) prayer (to God), (b) a place for prayer (used by Jews, perhaps
                  where there was no synagogue).
I pray, pray for, offer prayer.
I pay attention to, devote myself to

(a) I attend to, pay attention to, (b) I beware, am cautious, (c) I
                  join, devote myself to.
I fasten with nails, nail to.

(lit: that has come to), a proselyte, that is a non-Jew, who has been
                  circumcised and has adopted the Jews' religion.
I persist, persevere in, continue steadfast in; I wait upon.
I assign by lot, allot, associate with, follow as a disciple.

(lit: I glue one thing to another), I join (unite) closely, cleave
                  (to), follow as an adherent.

a stumbling-block, an occasion for falling, a moral
                  embarrassment.
a cause of stumbling, offense, shock.
I stumble, strike the foot against, beat upon, take offense at.
I roll to, roll up against.
I go down on my knees to, do obeisance to, worship.
(a) I take to myself, (b) I take aside, (c) I welcome.
a receiving, a taking to one's self, acceptance.
I remain; I abide in, remain in, persist in, adhere to.
I am displeased or offended with.
I fasten to, applied to Christ's being fastened to the cross.
I fall down before, beat against
(a) I fall down before, (b) I beat against, rush violently upon.
I pretend, regard, make a show of.
(a) I instruct, command, (b) I appoint, assign.
I put to, add, do again
I place (put) to, add; I do again.
anything eaten with bread, especially fish or meat.
(originally: newly slaughtered, freshly killed), recent, new.

(a) I bring to, (b) characteristically: I offer (of gifts, sacrifices,
                  etc).

I call to, summon; I call (out) to, address, give a speech to,
                  harangue.
a pouring upon, an effusion, a sprinkling.
I stretch out, tie up (for scourging), extend before.
I run before, outrun, run in advance.
I have been already, have been previously.

prophecy, prophesying; the gift of communicating and enforcing revealed
                  truth.

I foretell, prophesy; I set forth matter of divine teaching by special
                  faculty.
a prophet, poet; a person gifted at expositing divine truth.
I appoint, choose, elect, take into hand.
Prochorus, one of the seven original deacons at Jerusalem.
early in the morning, at dawn
early in the morning, at dawn.
I have preeminence, am chief, am first.
the chief place at a banquet
the chief place at a banquet or table.
first, in the first place, before, formerly.

one who stands in the front rank, hence: a leader, ringleader,
                  chief.
the birthright, the rights of the first-born.
I stumble, fall, sin, err, transgress.
I terrify, scare, strike with panic.

Ptolemais, a coast city of Phoenicia, midway between Tyre and
                  Caesarea.
a simple wooden pitchfork; a winnowing-shovel or fan.
I fold, roll up (as a scroll).
a fall; a carcass, corpse, dead body.
I am in poverty, am a beggar.

poor, destitute, spiritually poor, either in a good sense (humble
                  devout persons) or bad.

a divining spirit, Python, called after the Pythian serpent said to
                  have guarded the oracle at Delphi and been slain by Apollo.
a large gate, a gateway, porch
a large gate; a gateway, porch, vestibule.
I ask, inquire, ascertain by inquiry, understand.

fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal
                  fire.
a fire, pile of burning fuel.
I am sick with a fever
I am sick with a fever.
I burn, am purified by fire

pass: I burn, am set on fire, am inflamed; glow with heat, am purified
                  by fire.
how, in what manner, by what means.
